intro: Tulbaghia cominsii, commonly known as the Cape tulbaghia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and clusters of fragrant, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is often used in rock gardens and as a ground cover due to its hardiness and ornamental value. Tulbaghia cominsii is also noted for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
